The create_citations function

Matthew Wankiewicz

2021-09-08

Source: vignettes/create_citations_vignette.Rmd
create_citations_vignette.Rmd

About the Function

create_citations was made to speed up the process of getting citations for your R papers, reports or anything else. Instead of having to run citation multiple times, you can run create_citations once to get all of your citations done quickly. The citations are returned in the console or under your R chunk, making it easy to copy and paste.

Using the function

Making the citations

There are two ways to gather the packages used to create citations. The first way to gather the packages is to leave the packages argument empty. Doing this tells the function to take any package that has been loaded into your R session and create citations for it.

create_citations()
#> @Manual{,
#>   title = {citationcheckR: Citation Checker for R},
#>   author = {Matthew Wankiewicz},
#>   year = {2021},
#>   note = {R package version 0.1.0},
#>   url = {https://github.com/matthewwankiewicz/citationcheckR},
#> }
#> 
#> @Manual{,
#>   title = {R: A Language and Environment for Statistical Computing},
#>   author = {{R Core Team}},
#>   organization = {R Foundation for Statistical Computing},
#>   address = {Vienna, Austria},
#>   year = {2019},
#>   url = {https://www.R-project.org/},
#> }

The other way to create citations is to fill the citations arugment with the packages you want to get citations for.

create_citations(c("Lahman", "tidyverse", "DoSStoolkit"))
#> @Manual{,
#>   title = {Lahman: Sean 'Lahman' Baseball Database},
#>   author = {Michael Friendly and Chris Dalzell and Martin Monkman and Dennis Murphy},
#>   year = {2021},
#>   note = {R package version 9.0-0},
#>   url = {https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=Lahman},
#> }
#> 
#> @Article{,
#>   title = {Welcome to the {tidyverse}},
#>   author = {Hadley Wickham and Mara Averick and Jennifer Bryan and Winston Chang and Lucy D'Agostino McGowan and Romain François and Garrett Grolemund and Alex Hayes and Lionel Henry and Jim Hester and Max Kuhn and Thomas Lin Pedersen and Evan Miller and Stephan Milton Bache and Kirill Müller and Jeroen Ooms and David Robinson and Dana Paige Seidel and Vitalie Spinu and Kohske Takahashi and Davis Vaughan and Claus Wilke and Kara Woo and Hiroaki Yutani},
#>   year = {2019},
#>   journal = {Journal of Open Source Software},
#>   volume = {4},
#>   number = {43},
#>   pages = {1686},
#>   doi = {10.21105/joss.01686},
#> }
#> 
#> @Manual{,
#>   title = {DoSStoolkit: Self-Paced Modules to Help You Learn R},
#>   author = {Rohan Alexander and Samantha-Jo Caetano and Annie Collins and Haoluan Chen and Isaac Ehrlich and Mariam Walaa and Marija Pejcinovska and Matthew Wankiewicz and Michael Chong and Paul Hodgetts and Shirley Deng and Yena Joo},
#>   year = {2021},
#>   note = {R package version 0.2.0},
#>   url = {https://github.com/RohanAlexander/DoSStoolkit},
#> }
#> 
#> @Manual{,
#>   title = {R: A Language and Environment for Statistical Computing},
#>   author = {{R Core Team}},
#>   organization = {R Foundation for Statistical Computing},
#>   address = {Vienna, Austria},
#>   year = {2019},
#>   url = {https://www.R-project.org/},
#> }

Including R

As you may have noticed, the citations that were returned included a citation for R. This is done by default and can be turned off using include_r = FALSE.

create_citations(c("Lahman", "tidyverse", "DoSStoolkit"), include_r = FALSE)
#> @Manual{,
#>   title = {Lahman: Sean 'Lahman' Baseball Database},
#>   author = {Michael Friendly and Chris Dalzell and Martin Monkman and Dennis Murphy},
#>   year = {2021},
#>   note = {R package version 9.0-0},
#>   url = {https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=Lahman},
#> }
#> 
#> @Article{,
#>   title = {Welcome to the {tidyverse}},
#>   author = {Hadley Wickham and Mara Averick and Jennifer Bryan and Winston Chang and Lucy D'Agostino McGowan and Romain François and Garrett Grolemund and Alex Hayes and Lionel Henry and Jim Hester and Max Kuhn and Thomas Lin Pedersen and Evan Miller and Stephan Milton Bache and Kirill Müller and Jeroen Ooms and David Robinson and Dana Paige Seidel and Vitalie Spinu and Kohske Takahashi and Davis Vaughan and Claus Wilke and Kara Woo and Hiroaki Yutani},
#>   year = {2019},
#>   journal = {Journal of Open Source Software},
#>   volume = {4},
#>   number = {43},
#>   pages = {1686},
#>   doi = {10.21105/joss.01686},
#> }
#> 
#> @Manual{,
#>   title = {DoSStoolkit: Self-Paced Modules to Help You Learn R},
#>   author = {Rohan Alexander and Samantha-Jo Caetano and Annie Collins and Haoluan Chen and Isaac Ehrlich and Mariam Walaa and Marija Pejcinovska and Matthew Wankiewicz and Michael Chong and Paul Hodgetts and Shirley Deng and Yena Joo},
#>   year = {2021},
#>   note = {R package version 0.2.0},
#>   url = {https://github.com/RohanAlexander/DoSStoolkit},
#> }

Changing Citation Formats

By default, create_citations will return citations as bibTeX, but this can be changed by setting format = 'text'

create_citations(c("Lahman", "tidyverse", "DoSStoolkit"),
                 include_r = FALSE, format = "text")
#> Friendly M, Dalzell C, Monkman M, Murphy D (2021). _Lahman: Sean
#> 'Lahman' Baseball Database_. R package version 9.0-0, <URL:
#> https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=Lahman>.
#> 
#> Wickham H, Averick M, Bryan J, Chang W, McGowan LD, François R,
#> Grolemund G, Hayes A, Henry L, Hester J, Kuhn M, Pedersen TL, Miller E,
#> Bache SM, Müller K, Ooms J, Robinson D, Seidel DP, Spinu V, Takahashi
#> K, Vaughan D, Wilke C, Woo K, Yutani H (2019). "Welcome to the
#> tidyverse." _Journal of Open Source Software_, *4*(43), 1686. doi:
#> 10.21105/joss.01686 (URL: https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.01686).
#> 
#> Alexander R, Caetano S, Collins A, Chen H, Ehrlich I, Walaa M,
#> Pejcinovska M, Wankiewicz M, Chong M, Hodgetts P, Deng S, Joo Y (2021).
#> _DoSStoolkit: Self-Paced Modules to Help You Learn R_. R package
#> version 0.2.0, <URL: https://github.com/RohanAlexander/DoSStoolkit>.
